meanings.definition: Of or relating to an eye-like spot, as on a feather or insect.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly had beautiful ocellar patterns on its wings.
meanings.sent2: The ocellar markings on the peacock's feathers were stunning.
meanings.sent3: The ocellar design on the moth's wing looked like a tiny eye.
meanings.sent4: The ocellar spots on the bird's plumage seemed to watch you.
meanings.sent5: The ocellar details on the beetle's shell were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A small, simple eye or eyespot.
meanings.sent1: The insect's ocellar helped it detect movement around.
meanings.sent2: The frog's ocellar was crucial for spotting prey.
meanings.sent3: The ocellar on the fish's body made it look cute.
meanings.sent4: The ocellar of the tiny spider seemed to blink at me.
meanings.sent5: The ocellar of the lizard was small but very perceptive.
